abstract: Laurence D. Fink, the chairman and chief executive of BlackRock, said that he’s frightened by the European sovereign debt crisis, but thinks the euro will survive.
snippet: Laurence D. Fink, the chairman and chief executive of BlackRock, said that he’s frightened by the European sovereign debt crisis, but thinks the euro will survive.
lead_paragraph: Laurence D. Fink, the chairman and chief executive of BlackRock, minced no words about the European sovereign debt crisis, saying on Wednesday that he was “frightened” and was avoiding investing in the debt of southern Europe.

headline.main: Fink Worries About Europe, but Sees Euro Surviving
